info.name: API Doc - SRC Custom Integration
info.description: Shiprocket Checkout is a fast, secure, and conversion-optimized checkout solution built for Indian D2C brands. This document helps developers integrate the checkout on custom websites via APIs, catalog sync, and a lightweight JS snippet.

item.name: Catalog APIs

request.description:
Note:

  • products[].id and products[].variants[].id must be unique

  • Both ids should be of long data-type

response.name: Paginated Fetch
Paginated Fetch
Paginated Fetch

item.description: These APIs are to be created by the seller's development team so that Shiprocket system can utilize the APIs to sync catalog/product details to their backend.

item.name: Catalog Webhooks

header.value: default-src 'self' https:; font-src 'self' https: data:; img-src 'self' https: data:; object-src 'none'; script-src https:; style-src 'self' https: 'unsafe-inline'
default-src 'self' https:; font-src 'self' https: data:; img-src 'self' https: data:; object-src 'none'; script-src https:; style-src 'self' https: 'unsafe-inline'

item.description:
These are webhooks sent by merchant's system to shiprocket for syncing the products automatically. The auth for webhooks works in a similar way to API Auth (Headers X-Api-Key and X-Api-HMAC-SHA256 of request body)

HTTP Statuses

  • 200 - OK

  • 511 - Invalid X-Api-Key or calculated hmac in X-Api-HMAC-SHA256

  • 404 - Not found

request.description:
Values

  • status - CREATED / INITIATED / FAILED / SUCCESS

  • source - web / m-web

  • payment_type - CASH_ON_DELIVERY / PREPAID

  • payment_status - Pending / Success / Failed

request.description:
Values

  • start_date, end_date (mandatory) - datetime in UTC in ISO Datetime format

  • timestamp (mandatory) - current datetime in UTC in ISO Datetime format.

  • status (optional) - [SUCCESS, INITIATED].

  • limit (optional) - between [0, 250]. Default - 200

  • page - Must be >0. Default - 0

Response

  • List of Order id with status, sorted by date in descending order.

  • total - count of total orders matched

item.description:
These are checkout related APIs in order to initiate checkout or get order details.

API's require header

  • X-Api-Key - will be provided by shiprocket's team

  • X-Api-HMAC-SHA256 - (HMAC SHA256 in Base64 calculated using Api Secret. See this)

API BASE URL -

STAGING - https://fastrr-api-dev.pickrr.com

PRODUCTION - https://checkout-api.shiprocket.com

request.description: Although webhooks will be sent almost everytime, we recommend create a some periodic jobs as a failsafe for pending orders to check for their status (See Order/Details API in Checkout APIs section)

item.description:
These are webhooks sent by shiprocket to seller's URL. Response is expected to be with status 200.

Note: Webhooks may be sent more than once as well.

item.name: Checkout UI Flow
item.description:
• Add script and css

    • STAGING

      • https://customcheckoutfastrr.netlify.app/assets/js/channels/shopify.js

      • https://customcheckoutfastrr.netlify.app/assets/styles/shopify.css

    • PROD

      • https://checkout-ui.shiprocket.com/assets/js/channels/shopify.js

      • https://checkout-ui.shiprocket.com/assets/styles/shopify.css

  • Generate Checkout Access Token = token on click of Buy Now / Checkout button on website

  • Call HeadlessCheckout.addToCart function on click of Buy Now / Checkout button on website and pass in token

  • If order is successfully placed user is redirected to the redirect_url specified when creating the access token.

  • Fallback URL needs to be passed in the said function just to ensure in rare cases whenever checkout server is down, customer will be redirected to this fallback URL ( must be merchant's native checkout URL).

Example

<html>
<head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
    <title>Test</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://checkout-ui.shiprocket.com/assets/styles/shopify.css">
</head>
<body>
    <button id="buyNow">Checkout</button>
    <script>
        const button = document.getElementById('buyNow');
        button.addEventListener('click', async (e) => {
            const token = "" // Generate token here
            HeadlessCheckout.addToCart(event, token, {fallbackUrl: "https://your.fallback.com?product=123", isInitiatedFromApp: true})
        })
    </script>
    <script src="https://checkout-ui.shiprocket.com/assets/js/channels/shopify.js"></script>
</body>
</html>

request.description: This API will be consumed by shiprocket to get available loyalty balance of the customer with given contact number.
This API will be consumed by shiprocket to block applicable points against the customer with given contact number for that generated order id.

This API will be consumed by shiprocket to unblock applicable points against the customer for that generated order id when customer clicks on Remove Points option, Exit Checkout or Change number.

If customer reload the page or close the tab, unblock needs to be triggered by merchant's system if points are blocked and final bill not generated for a specific time frame.
